intro: Triumfetta hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a small shrub or herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features opposite, hairy, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in axillary inflorescences. Triumfetta hirsuta produces small, round, yellow or brown fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
